verses.verse: When Ephraim <WH669> spake <WH1696> trembling <WH7578>, he exalted <WH5375> himself in Israel <WH3478>; but when he offended <WH816> in Baal <WH1168>, he died <WH4191>.

And now they sin <WH2398> more and more <WH3254>, and have made <WH6213> them molten images <WH4541> of their silver <WH3701>, and idols <WH6091> according to their own understanding <WH8394>, all of it the work <WH4639> of the craftsmen <WH2796>: they say <WH559> of them, Let the men <WH120> that sacrifice <WH2076> kiss <WH5401> the calves <WH5695>. they sin: Heb. they add to sin the men: or, the sacrificers of men

Therefore they shall be as the morning <WH1242> cloud <WH6051>, and as the early <WH7925> dew <WH2919> that passeth away <WH1980>, as the chaff <WH4671> that is driven with the whirlwind <WH5590> out of the floor <WH1637>, and as the smoke <WH6227> out of the chimney <WH699>.
Yet I am the LORD <WH3068> thy God <WH430> from the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>, and thou shalt know <WH3045> no god <WH430> but me <WH2108>: for there is no saviour <WH3467> beside me <WH1115>.
I did know <WH3045> thee in the wilderness <WH4057>, in the land <WH776> of great drought <WH8514>. great: Heb. droughts
According to their pasture <WH4830>, so were they filled <WH7646>; they were filled <WH7646>, and their heart <WH3820> was exalted <WH7311>; therefore have they forgotten <WH7911> me.
Therefore I will be unto them as a lion <WH7826>: as a leopard <WH5246> by the way <WH1870> will I observe <WH7789> them:

I will meet <WH6298> them as a bear <WH1677> that is bereaved <WH7909> of her whelps, and will rend <WH7167> the caul <WH5458> of their heart <WH3820>, and there will I devour <WH398> them like a lion <WH3833>: the wild <WH7704> beast <WH2416> shall tear <WH1234> them. wild: Heb. beast of the field
O Israel <WH3478>, thou hast destroyed <WH7843> thyself; but in me is thine help <WH5828>. is: Heb. in thy help

I will <WH165> be thy king <WH4428>: where <WH645> is any other that may save <WH3467> thee in all thy cities <WH5892>? and thy judges <WH8199> of whom thou saidst <WH559>, Give <WH5414> me a king <WH4428> and princes <WH8269>? I will: rather, Where is thy king?
I gave <WH5414> thee a king <WH4428> in mine anger <WH639>, and took <WH3947> him away in my wrath <WH5678>.
The iniquity <WH5771> of Ephraim <WH669> is bound up <WH6887>; his sin <WH2403> is hid <WH6845>.

The sorrows <WH2256> of a travailing woman <WH3205> shall come <WH935> upon him: he is an unwise <WH2450> son <WH1121>; for he should not stay <WH5975> long <WH6256> in the place of the breaking forth <WH4866> of children <WH1121>. long: Heb. a time

I will ransom <WH6299> them from the power <WH3027> of the grave <WH7585>; I will redeem <WH1350> them from death <WH4194>: O death <WH4194>, I will <WH165> be thy plagues <WH1698>; O grave <WH7585>, I will <WH165> be thy destruction <WH6987>: repentance <WH5164> shall be hid <WH5641> from mine eyes <WH5869>. power: Heb. hand

Though he be fruitful <WH6500> among his brethren <WH251>, an east wind <WH6921> shall come <WH935>, the wind <WH7307> of the LORD <WH3068> shall come up <WH5927> from the wilderness <WH4057>, and his spring <WH4726> shall become dry <WH954>, and his fountain <WH4599> shall be dried up <WH2717>: he shall spoil <WH8154> the treasure <WH214> of all pleasant <WH2532> vessels <WH3627>. pleasant: Heb. vessels of desire

Samaria <WH8111> shall become desolate <WH816>; for she hath rebelled <WH4784> against her God <WH430>: they shall fall <WH5307> by the sword <WH2719>: their infants <WH5768> shall be dashed in pieces <WH7376>, and their women with child <WH2030> shall be ripped up <WH1234>.
